parameters.query:
-- Find duplicate knowledge entries using vector similarity
WITH similarity_pairs AS (
  SELECT
    kb1.id AS id1,
    kb1.title AS title1,
    kb2.id AS id2,
    kb2.title AS title2,
    kb1.embedding <-> kb2.embedding AS distance,
    1 - (kb1.embedding <-> kb2.embedding) AS similarity
  FROM knowledge_base kb1
  CROSS JOIN knowledge_base kb2
  WHERE kb1.id < kb2.id  -- Avoid duplicate pairs and self-comparison
    AND kb1.metadata->>'status' = 'active'
    AND kb2.metadata->>'status' = 'active'
    AND (kb1.embedding <-> kb2.embedding) < 0.1  -- Very similar (distance < 0.1)
)
SELECT
  id1,
  title1,
  id2,
  title2,
  distance,
  similarity
FROM similarity_pairs
ORDER BY similarity DESC
LIMIT 50;

-- Calculate success rates for knowledge entries
WITH entry_usage AS (
  SELECT
    te.category,
    COUNT(*) AS total_uses,
    COUNT(*) FILTER (WHERE te.customer_satisfaction >= 4) AS successful_uses,
    AVG(te.customer_satisfaction) AS avg_satisfaction
  FROM training_examples te
  WHERE te.created_at > NOW() - INTERVAL '90 days'
  GROUP BY te.category
)
SELECT
  kb.id,
  kb.title,
  kb.metadata->>'category' AS category,
  kb.metadata->>'success_rate' AS current_success_rate,
  COALESCE(
    eu.successful_uses::float / NULLIF(eu.total_uses, 0),
    (kb.metadata->>'success_rate')::float
  ) AS calculated_success_rate,
  eu.total_uses,
  eu.avg_satisfaction
FROM knowledge_base kb
LEFT JOIN entry_usage eu ON kb.metadata->>'category' = eu.category
WHERE kb.metadata->>'status' = 'active'
  AND (
    eu.total_uses > 10  -- Only update if sufficient data
    AND (
      COALESCE(eu.successful_uses::float / NULLIF(eu.total_uses, 0), 0) < 0.7  -- Flag low performers
      OR ABS(
        COALESCE(eu.successful_uses::float / NULLIF(eu.total_uses, 0), 0) - 
        COALESCE((kb.metadata->>'success_rate')::float, 0)
      ) > 0.1  -- Significant change
    )
  )
ORDER BY calculated_success_rate ASC
LIMIT 20;

-- Find stale knowledge entries (not used in 6+ months)
SELECT
  kb.id,
  kb.title,
  kb.metadata->>'category' AS category,
  kb.updated_at,
  EXTRACT(EPOCH FROM (NOW() - kb.updated_at)) / 86400 AS days_since_update
FROM knowledge_base kb
WHERE kb.metadata->>'status' = 'active'
  AND kb.updated_at < NOW() - INTERVAL '6 months'
ORDER BY kb.updated_at ASC
LIMIT 30;

-- Detect recurring issues (similar tickets in past 7 days)
WITH recent_tickets AS (
  SELECT
    ticket_text,
    category,
    embedding,
    created_at
  FROM training_examples
  WHERE created_at > NOW() - INTERVAL '7 days'
),
similarity_clusters AS (
  SELECT
    rt1.ticket_text AS ticket1,
    rt2.ticket_text AS ticket2,
    rt1.category,
    rt1.embedding <-> rt2.embedding AS distance,
    1 - (rt1.embedding <-> rt2.embedding) AS similarity
  FROM recent_tickets rt1
  CROSS JOIN recent_tickets rt2
  WHERE rt1.created_at < rt2.created_at
    AND (rt1.embedding <-> rt2.embedding) < 0.1  -- Very similar
)
SELECT
  category,
  COUNT(*) AS cluster_size,
  AVG(similarity) AS avg_similarity,
  ARRAY_AGG(DISTINCT ticket1) AS sample_tickets
FROM similarity_clusters
GROUP BY category
HAVING COUNT(*) >= 3  -- At least 3 similar tickets
ORDER BY cluster_size DESC
LIMIT 10;
